subject: RE: The goals of CMM (Re: [junit] wanted Junit professionals urgently)
msgSnippet: ... Actually, I ve found that without the scripts I spend less time testing, because doing a test similar to a previous test but with just a couple of things
messageBody:
On Tue, 26 Aug 2003, Michael Silverstein wrote:

> The good part of ET is that you spend less time coming up with scripts
> and automating and more time testing, so you have a greater liklihood of
> going down a path you might not otherwise have tested.

Actually, I've found that without the scripts I spend less time testing,
because doing a test similar to a previous test but with just a couple
of things changed isn't just a matter if a quick cut, paste and run.

And this is even for GUI apps, albeit web-based ones. Finally scripting
the web-based stuff allowed us to try new tests an order of magnitude
faster than we used to be able to, in some cases.

(But please, don't take this as I'm saying this is a silver bullet, or
will be better in every single situation.)

cjs
